00095     def getCurrentValue(self, row):
00096         objectReference = self.plotItemsplotItems[PlotBrowser.currentItem]
00097         #apiKeyword = self.properties[row][3]
00098         #value=getp(objectReference, apiKeyword)
00099         eval(objectReference+'.get('++')')
00100         
00101         #first take care of some special cases for formatting purposes:
00102         sequence2String=['xlim','ylim']
00103         array2String=['xticks','yticks','xdata','ydata']
00104         textBox2String=['xticklabels','yticklabels']
00105         if type(apiKeyword)==type(1.0) or type(apiKeyword)==type(1):
00106             value=self.roundNChopNStringroundNChopNString(value)
00107         elif apiKeyword in sequence2String:
00108             value=self.roundNChopNStringroundNChopNString(value)
00109         elif apiKeyword in array2String:
00110             value=value.tolist()
00111             value=self.roundNChopNStringroundNChopNString(value)
00112         elif apiKeyword in textBox2String:
00113             #from wx.text import Text
00114             strings=[]
00115             for textInstance in value:
00116                 strings.append(textInstance.get_text())
00117             value=strings
00118         return value

00120     def roundNChopNString(self,num):
00121         '''This rounds everything to three decimal places and eventually chops off trailing stuff'''
00122         if type(num)==type(1.0):# or type(num)==type(1):
00123             return round(num,3)
00124         elif type(num)==type([1.0]):
00125             newNum=[]
00126             for i in range(len(num)):
00127                 newNum.append(round(num[i],3))
00128             return num
00129         elif type(num)==type((1.0,)):
00130             newNum=[]
00131             for i in range(len(num)):
00132                 newNum.append(round(num[i],3))
00133             return tuple(num)
00134

00139     def GetNumberRows(self):
00140         return len(self.datadata)
00141 
00142     def GetNumberCols(self):
00143         return len(self.datadata[0])
00144 
00145     def IsEmptyCell(self, row, col):
00146         try:
00147             return not self.datadata[row][col]
00148         except IndexError:
00149             return True
00150 
00151     # Get/Set values in the table.  The Python version of these
00152     # methods can handle any data-type, (as long as the Editor and
00153     # Renderer understands the type too,) not just strings as in the
00154     # C++ version.
00155     def GetValue(self, row, col):
00156         try:
00157             return self.datadata[row][col]
00158         except IndexError:
00159             return ''
00160 
00161     def SetValue(self, row, col, value):
00162         
00163         try:
00164             self.datadata[row][col] = value
00165         except IndexError:
00166             # add a new row
00167             self.datadata.append([''] * self.GetNumberColsGetNumberCols())
00168             self.SetValueSetValue(row, col, value)
00169 
00170             # tell the grid we've added a row
00171             msg = gridlib.GridTableMessage(self,            # The table
00172                     gridlib.GRIDTABLE_NOTIFY_ROWS_APPENDED, # what we did to it
00173                     1                                       # how many
00174                     )
00175 
00176             self.GetView().ProcessTableMessage(msg)
00177

00181     # Called when the grid needs to display labels
00182     def GetColLabelValue(self, col):
00183         return self.colLabelscolLabels[col]

00185     # Called to determine the kind of editor/renderer to use by
00186     # default, doesn't necessarily have to be the same type used
00187     # natively by the editor/renderer if they know how to convert.
00188     def GetTypeName(self, row, col):
00189         if col==0:
00190             return gridlib.GRID_VALUE_STRING
00191         else:
00192             return self.dataTypesdataTypes[row]
00193 
00194     # Called to determine how the data can be fetched and stored by the
00195     # editor and renderer.  This allows you to enforce some type-safety
00196     # in the grid.
00197     def CanGetValueAs(self, row, col, typeName):
00198         #can't change the first column
00199         if col==0:
00200             return False
00201         # everything in second column depends on the row
00202         entryType = self.dataTypesdataTypes[row].split(':')[0]
00203         if typeName == entryType:
00204             return True
00205         else:
00206             return False
00207 
00208     def CanSetValueAs(self, row, col, typeName):
00209         return self.CanGetValueAsCanGetValueAs(row, col, typeName)
